intro: Clematis sophia, commonly known as the white clematis, is a deciduous vine native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis sophia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
